critique: The document establishes a Retraining and Reemployment Administration to oversee the transition of veterans and war workers back into civilian life after World War II. It centralizes authority under the Director of War Mobilization and involves multiple government agencies in developing programs for job training, employment assistance, and care for discharged personnel. The order emphasizes integrating these programs with wartime manpower controls and utilizing existing government agencies. The document reflects a strong federal role in managing the post-war economy and supporting veterans, indicating a focus on government intervention and social inclusion.
